newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Brent well supported, looks to $18.35-40.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Brent well supported, looks to $18.35-40.

text.p: IPE Brent crude oil futures were well supported on the charts and traders and technical analysts said on Thursday that a recently neutral market was likely to test gingerly upwards.
June Brent closed nine cents a barrel firmer on Wednesday at $18.16, while June gas oil gained a dollar to end the day at $167.50.

While we have been seeing the formation of a sideways channel the market has recently been trying to move higher - there have been more attacks to the upside than to the downside, said Tom James at Credit Lyonnais Rouse in Singapore.
There is very strong support between $17.75 and $18.00 and we have not seen the market trying to make new lows to the range.
He said that he also expected a summer rally in U.S. gasoline prices to support energy markets.
When gasoline finally stirs from its sleep things could happen quite quickly.
Resistance, he said, would be encountered around the site of previous congestion on the charts at $18.35-$18.40.
Steve Kwan at MMS in London saw a similar picture, although he was a little more cautious about the technical patterns.
"After the long downwards move (of this year) we have seen a lot of speculative buying underneath $18.00," he said. "This is potentially bullish."
"We are looking for range trading today," he said, and anticipated the market would remain witin a 50 cent band above $18.00.
"But at the moment the technical patterns are not clear. We could be forming a bear flag, or we could be forming a base. We need to have a few sessions under $18.00 to turn bearish."
He said the key on the upside remains the gap between $18.75 and $18.77 formed last month.
"If we break $18.77 then we are likely to move above $19.00."
Gas oil, James said, would find suport first at the psychological level of $165.00, and then at around $163.50.
